description: Erection of single storey rear extension (5.0m in depth, maximum height of 3.9m and eaves height of 3.0m)
decision_conditions: The proposed erection of single storey rear extension falls within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

--- Officer Report ---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents. By indicating that the development proposal complies with relevant Development Plan policies, the planning officer is taking into account the information submitted with the application, any previous relevant applications, any comments received in connection with the application and any other case specific considerations which are material to the decision.The Development Plan comprises:The London Plan 2021;RBK Core Strategy 2012;Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan 2008; and,The South London Waste Plan 2022.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.Application SiteThe site comprises a residential dwelling.ConsultationOne objection received. The objection is summarised as follows and the matters raised addressed in the officers assessment.- Excessive height or bulk of buildings- Fumes- Loss of light/Sunlight- Noise- PrivacyAssessmentThe key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.- Other mattersDesignWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS) (2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: The proposed side and rear extensions would not follow the guiding principles of the LPA's adopted LDF Residential Design SPD. The proposed development is considered to not be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design and would have an adverse impact on the character and appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development. The side extension would extend out to the side boundary at 1st floor level and erode the spaciousness of the plot and the gap in the built form between the adjacent plot 17 Glebe Gardens creating an incongruous addition and would detract from the character and appearance of the host property and the surrounding area. The LPA's Residential Design SPD recommends that a 1 metre gap should be maintained between the side elevation and the side boundary of 1st floor side extensions. The proposed single storey extension would have a depth of 4 metres, have a flat roof and span the width of the plot. It is considered that the proposed extension would in particular due to its depth and positioning along the side boundaries create a dominant and overbearing feature that would create an unnecessary sense of enclosure to the neighbouring properties either side of the plot in particular that of the adjoining semi-detached property 11 Glebe Gardens. The Council's Residential Design SPD recommends that single storey rear extensions should be kept to a depth of between 3 - 3.5 metres.It is considered that the proposed front porch extension would be a subordinate addition and of an architectural style sympathetic to the host property. Neighbouring AmenitiesPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of loss of privacy. The specific objection raised on grounds of loss of light related to either external outdoor space, non habitable floorspace/rooms or secondary habitable room windows. Whilst it is acknowledged that the proposal is likely to give rise to some loss of light to the neighbouring occupiers it is considered that this would not be to a degree sufficient to cause undue harm to the existing living conditions of the neighbouring occupiers. Other matters Objections have been raised in regards to the construction phase of the development in regards to dust, fumes, noise and general disturbance. Such matters would be primarily controlled by the constraints of the Building regulations and the Control of Pollution Act 1974, the Clean Air Acts and other relevant legislation, and any works undertaken which impact unreasonably upon the surrounding area may be subject to action by the Council's Environmental Health Department.  ConclusionIn conclusion, the proposed development is considered to not be in accordance with the development plan and there are no other material considerations which warrant a decision other than not in accordance with the development plan.Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application.https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal--- Informatives ---Positive and ProactiveIn dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.
